channel.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
channel.description:
**Challenge:** effect patches - sound modifying patches
create a patch which can change an external (or internal) sound input, and can be influenced/controlled by the user with 5 or less controls, at top of patch, and clearly labelled
**Submission window:** Tuesday 29th March 00:00 - Thursday 31st March 23:59 (CET)
**Voting window:** Friday 1st April - Tuesday 5th April 23:59 (CET)
**Constraints:**
maximum 5 parameters for real time control. single patch file (axp)
**Voting Criteria:**
Usefulness Originality / Extravagance Patch clarity (is it still possible to see how the patch works?)
**Hints/Suggestions:**
use patch/patcher rather than axs (due to single file constraint) the constraint is on main control, other controls can be included for fin ajustements etc

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @JeromeB
item.description:
@JeromeB wrote:

Thanks for your feedback @Sputnki ! I must rework the stereo expander. I don't like noise on the right ear when play with delay knob and stereo expander frequency knob. I'm agree with that. I moved the 2 mixers below everything they have on the left, but this take no effects. I look for a better solution to increase stereo depth. The @kausto reverb is a very good solution.

Thank @rbrt, I'm playing with your looper !

Read full topic

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

Maybe i'm a bit late, but i tried the patches, and i'd like to give some feedback (also, i'm so terribly sorry i did not partecipate this month, but as i said earlier zero inspiration, and i put all of my efforts in programming those tables).

To all of you: i'm quite disappointed, because nobody has put a master volume knob before the output.
You should be ashamed.

@JeromeB : awesome. You did a great job with your patch. I wished i could record some of the produced sounds, i got glitches and bleeps and all of the amazing stuff you could want from a bitcrusher.
However, i noticed a very slight stereo imaging, even with the stereo knob set to zero. I think is a problem of (sigh) order of execution. You should move the two mixer objects below everything they have on the left, and the audio output object even lower than that. This way you let the two signals be processed the same way before feeding them out.
I don't like how the stereo expander is implemented, it muddens the sound when the dial is halfway, and basically it's usable only at the extreme settings.
Good choice to put that highpass filter before the effect, sounds very nice.
Also great resource management: 7% for such an effect is pretty decent to me.

I'd say: make a stomp version of the effect, maybe mono: everyone will love it!

@mtyas amazing patchwork, as always, were you inspired by the aira mx1 ?
It's nice to have a performance dedicated effect, especially because you can use it to make rythmic stuff. I made an hip hop beat out of " Rain Sleep Sounds White Noise | Fall Asleep, Fight Insomnia, Stay Sleeping All Night Long | 10 Hours ", which is pretty sweet if you think about it.
However some effects are just not usable enough (like the flanger, it's annoying to have it on all the time). The sequencer does not allow 16th triggers (which could be easily implemented with some logic patchwork, using the clock as a "reset" source for bool triggers).
I can't see this patch as an actual stompbox, either because of the huge resource consumption or because of how "general" it is.
Great work, overall!

@rbrt Your patch is my favourite. It's simple as hell, but it does it's work almost perfectly.
Only flaw i found is: once the loop is recorded, there's no way to manipulate it (at least slowing it down or pitching it up, please!)
You already made the standalone object, but the save feature with the index is just toooo juicy to have. Please
I'm happy i have sold my kaossilator pro. Who needs it now?

@philoop i'm sorry, but i could not test your patch, it gave me red errors and could not even load the patch.

Good competition, ultimately. A few entries but really interesting ones. You have my blessing.
However, if it was for me, nobody would have won this challenge, you would all have been disqualified for not putting the damn master volume knob.

I'd propose, for the next challenge, to rethink some aspects of sound synthesis.
For example: why only audio effects? Why don't we have effects for control rate signals?
What would a tap delay sound like, if applied after an envelope? And a chorus?
Also, why don't we use filters as shaping tools for lfos? What privilege do s-rate signals have that k-rate don't?

Read full topic

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @philoop
item.description:
@philoop wrote:

very nice reverb from kausto...

Continuing the discussion from Reverbs creation:

Reverbs creation

Thanks for this reminder about Tom Erbe. I love and use his plugins alot. Found this paper about Erbe-Verb:
http://quod.lib.umich.edu/cgi/p/pod/dod-idx/building-the-erbe-verb-extending-the-feedback-delay-network.pdf?c=icmc;idno=bbp2372.2015.054
which inspired me to build this FDN reverb (Erbe-Verb utilizes cortex m4 too, by the way)

Feel free to modify it for optimisations and improvements. I wouldn't mind against proper infinite sustain for example

Slightly optimized update (eats 29% CPU)
FDN-DemoUPD.axp (94.5 KB)

Read full topic

mtyas:

Do we really need to do a voting process ?

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Bravo guys... sorry not had a chance to participate, jealous of those that did!

Im with @philoop and @mtyas, Im not so much into the 'competition' element, hence why I named this section challenges, as I quite liked the idea for challenges as 'focused inspiration'. similarly I don't think constraints matter so much, that focus can come from anywhere

if there is a move to using the community library, then AXS files are not such an issue, similarly custom objects can be used

voting, I don't see if as vital either... and perhaps not really valid unless there are more entries.
I guess you'll have to work out a way to decide on the next challenge, but that can be done by consensus.

btw: the post regarding 'rules' is a wiki post, so anyone can edit it, to reflect the consensus of how its to be run

anyway well done to those competing, I hope I can get some time to come back to it this soon.

Read full topic

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

@philoop I don't mind abandoning all constraints excepte general theme (but can be "effects", "polysynth", "noodeling" ,"Bowie". Maybe just keep the "use patch/patcher rather than axs (due to single file constraint)" rule.

I'm so sorry I didn't even get to test this months patches yet, too many other things to do when in front of a computer, I'll get into it in the next few days. Bravo @JeromeB @rbrt and @philoop for participating. Do we really need to do a voting process ?

Otherwise any open ideas for the next competition(s), maybe make it last 2 months, I don't know, just an idea

Read full topic

item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

I'm sorry phil.. I had totally zero inspiration this month. I wanted to do some kind of distortion effect (hence the function tables that are still there to be used ), however i did not get any satisfactory results (even with crossover + saturation + hardclipping). The bitcrusher effect was already taken. I tried to do some glitch/stutter effect but it was nothing glorious at all, soo i hope into next competition

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @rbrt
item.description:
@rbrt wrote:

here's a last-minute contribution,based on this looper-object I did recently
you need axoloti patcher v 1.08 for it to work

LOOPER-STOMPER

looper-stomp.PNG1406x731 72.1 KB

it does what it does with 4 push-buttons and 1 dial,
RECORD -records a new loop
PLAY/OVERDUB -toggles playback and overdub
SAVE -writes th loop to sd-card
LOAD -loads the loop from sd-card
when you load a loop you've saved,LOOPER-STOMPER does remember the loop's length!
FEEDBACK -when set to anything than 64,the loop will decay gradually

looper_stomp.axp (12.2 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

Don't worry about not respecting the rules, no one will ever get disqualified in these competitions

I was wondering if, from this month, (I think @thetechnobear asked for it last month and we didn't all do it) we should try and put the patches in the 1.0.8 community library, especially if we use custom objects

I don't know if you're using 1.0.8 yet, but it would be much easier and help out in the debugging process too

as for submitting this months patches, I should normally create a new thread for it on the 1st April, so you still have time to get Github up and working for you.

Read full topic

item.title: March 2016 - Effects Patches (challenge/discussion)
item.dc:creator: @JeromeB
item.description:
@JeromeB wrote:

I don't know if I respect rules, but I have one patch with a custom object, 4 controls.
Was originally written for my volca bass (that have a mono output), to give it stereo depth (simple stereo expander) and some good distortions (bitcrusher with a filter).

BitCrusher.axp (7.8 KB)

biscuitage_m.axo (1.1 KB)

I wrote some explanation around the biscuitage_m object here : https://bitbucket.org/jburlando/diyaxolotilib/raw/ed403b159102a7289e04c1064560df4d9be71b65/objects/gaolib/biscuitage_m.zip

Feel free to give me feedback (and correcting my english , writing documentation is a good way to learn english).

Read full topic
